revised_title: Traces of Volcanoes on the Banks of the Rhine
tldr: In a letter to the Royal Society, Sir William Hamilton describes his observations of volcanic traces and geological formations along the banks of the Rhine River. He notes the presence of basaltic columns, tuffa, and lava, and suggests that these materials originated from subterranean fires. Hamilton also mentions the use of these volcanic materials in construction and the trade of tuffa with the Netherlands.
